Docs.param: An that contains the event data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The first time the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnActivated%2A> method is executed, it shows the first component editor page in the list.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnActivated%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnHelpRequested%2A> method shows the Help page that is associated with the component editor page, if there is one.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm.OnHelpRequested%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.
